body_html:
I think what is going on is that when I connect the client to machine B, the operations of machine A don't get scheduled on the GPU. At least, I get the exact same behaviour when scheduling operations on the CPU. I wish I could make sure nothing is running on the GPU but nvidia-smi does not support my graphics card (GTX 780). But the behaviours do really match for multiple workloads.

I am not sure how to see why that would happen. Again, tensorboard tells me the operations are on the GPU.

body:
I think what is going on is that when I connect the client to machine B, the operations of machine A don't get scheduled on the GPU. At least, I get the exact same behaviour when scheduling operations on the CPU. I wish I could make sure nothing is running on the GPU but `nvidia-smi` does not support my graphics card (GTX 780). But the behaviours do really match for multiple workloads.

I am not sure how to see why that would happen. Again, tensorboard tells me the operations are on the GPU.
